title: Looking for a sans similar to Etica
content:
any clues about this font?  
Thanks

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203113748im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/etica_5981.jpg)

 [‹ (x) "Thank You" fairly common handwritten sans - ITC Tempus Sans {Brandon S}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203113748/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38767 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Futuristic looking square sans in "Metron" logo - Bank Gothic {Andrea Tofano} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203113748/http:/www.typophile.com/node/38763 "Go to next forum topic")
author: slokai

comments.content:
[Ronnia](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203113748/http:/www.type-together.com/ampl_font.php?idpuente=11)

Edit: well, maybe not... looking at the lc a
Similar but no. Check the ’a’ in particular.
Where does this sample come from?

FRom here [http://www.leftloft.com/portfolio/lavori/tipografia/tipografia.asp](http://web.archive.org/web/20081203113748/http:/www.leftloft.com/portfolio/lavori/tipografia/tipografia.asp "http://www.leftloft.com/portfolio/lavori/tipografia/tipografia.asp")

That’s the name of it LL Etica.
I think you need to contact Leftloft about it. Doesn’t look like it’s for sale.

Thank you angel. Good one but ,unfortunately, it doesn’t look like for sale as you say.  
I’d like to find something similar. Any ideas?  
Thanks
